analytic.title: Rodolphi Waddingtoni decasticon in Psal∣morum encomion & huius operis

monogr.title: A proceeding in the harmonie of King Dauids harpe : That is to say, an exposition of 13. psalmes of the princely prophet Dauid, from the 22. vnto the 35. psalme, being a portion of the psalmes expounded by the reuerend Doctor Victorinus Strigelius, professor in Diuinity i the Vniuersity of Lipsia in Germany. Translated out of Latin into English by Richard Robinson, citizen of London. Anno Christi 1591. Seene and allovved
monogr.author: Strigel, Victorinus

div.head: Rodolphi Waddingtoni decasticon in Psalmorum encomion & huius operis
div.l: SVnt animae morbi varij dum corpore clausa est,
Horum qui quaerit sibi plene dulce leuamen,
Hic Dauidis Psalmos nocte dieque legat.
Hinc mens fracta malis se leuat atque fouet
Gratia prima Deo, Dauidi sit proxima regi,
Strigeliusque petit, ne sua laus pereat.
Tu tamen O Lector viue Richarde, canas.
